subsection_content:
Syphilis can be detected and treated effectively with specific antibiotics to inhibit the growth of the spirochete Treponema pallidum. However, because there is still no vaccine for the disease, prevention is better than cure. You can prevent your risk of getting sick by following these tips:
Do not have promiscuous sex. Be monogamous.; Use condoms to reduce the risk of infection, paying special attention to covering damaged areas.; Avoid using stimulants and alcohol to maintain good judgment and avoid unsafe sexual practices.; Do not share personal items with others to avoid bacteria remaining on surfaces and spreading through open wounds.; If syphilis is discovered before giving birth, the mother needs to notify the doctor for instructions on how to care for herself and prevent infection to the baby.; Follow the regular health check-up schedule every 6 months or as advised by your doctor; Enhance resistance by building a balanced menu, exercising regularly, avoiding stress.; Even though syphilis has been treated, the patient is still at risk of reinfection, so he or she should comply with the treatment course and take preventive measures recommended by a specialist.
